Class Indexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Indexer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UpdateIndex

    public class Indexer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Indexer class is an implementation of the Lucene API that stores the information extracted from various document types and stores them to be further searched using the Tika API. This class makes it possible to create an index, delete a document from the index, and add a document to the index.
    Author:
    Gina

        public static void writeIndex(java.lang.String dataDir,
                              java.io.FileFilter filter)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              org.apache.tika.exception.TikaException,
                              org.xml.sax.SAXException
        writeIndex will create an index given a path to the data directory and a file filter type. This is class will properly index the file depending on its file type.
        Parameters:

        Given a document type with the txt extension and the original document, getDocument will create a Document to be added into the index.
        Parameters:

        oldFile - Original file
        Returns:
        Returns a document to be added to the index

      • getDocument

        public static org.apache.lucene.document.Document getDocument(java.io.File newFile,
                                                              java.lang.String tokens,
                                                              java.io.File oldFile)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Given a document type with the txt extension, the original document, and key words that could be used to identify the document, getDocument will create a Document to be added into the index.
        Parameters:
        newFile - File with the extension .txt
        oldFile - Original file
        tokens - Key terms to be added into the index relative to the file
        Returns:
        Returns a document to be added to the index
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                                                                 java.io.File oldFile)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Given a document type with the txt extension, the original document that is NOT a readable document (such as pdf or docx) getDocument will create a Document to be added into the index.
        Parameters:
        newFile - File with the extension .txt
        oldFile - Original file
        Returns:
        Returns a document to be added to the index
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDocumentNot

        public static org.apache.lucene.document.Document getDocumentNot(java.io.File newFile,
                                                                 java.lang.String tokens,
                                                                 java.io.File oldFile)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Given a document type with the txt extension, the original document that is NOT a readable document (such as pdf or docx), and key words that could be used to identify the document, getDocument will create a Document to be added into the index.
        Parameters:
        newFile - File with the extension .txt
        oldFile - Original file
        tokens - Key terms to be added into the index relative to the file
        Returns:
        Returns a document to be added to the index
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • indexFileNot

        public static void indexFileNot(java.io.File newFile,
                                java.io.File oldFile)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        IndexFile will call the getDocument method to create the document object and then add it to the index. This function is called when the object is not a readable document (such as a pdf or docx).
        Parameters:
        newFile - File with the extension .txt
        oldFile - Original file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
